definition: can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: The quarrel between them rose from a misunderstanding.
sentences.chinese: 他倆之間的爭吵是由於誤會而造成的。

sentences.english: The matter put us at cross-purposes with them.
sentences.chinese: 這問題使我們跟他們產生了誤會。

sentences.english: We have acted to lessen misperceptions and miscommunication between our countries.
sentences.chinese: 我們已爲減少兩國間的誤解和誤會採取了行動。

sentences.english: Some people are under the misapprehension that all politicians stink.
sentences.chinese: 有些人誤會所有的政客都可疑。

sentences.english: Don’t get me wrong, I’m sad about the demise of print, too.
sentences.chinese: 別誤會我的意思，對於印刷品的消亡我也很難過。

sentences.english: This is liable to cause misunderstanding.
Honor he dating yourself by email misunderstanding, arrived at the restaurant, but only to appear.
sentences.chinese: 榮誤會玥以電郵約會自己，到達餐廳卻只見斯出現。

sentences.english: You mustn't read his smiling as friendship.
sentences.chinese: 你千萬不要把他的微笑誤會爲友好。

sentences.english: But finally it turned out to be a misunderstanding, Jef only took Carol as his little sister.
sentences.chinese: 結果是一場誤會，傑夫只是把她當成小妹妹。

sentences.english: Misunderstandings can occur, so that everyone here is better able to understand easily.
sentences.chinese: 也會發生誤會，在這裏還是讓大家容易看得懂爲宜。

sentences.english: There appears to have been a mistuned standing.
sentences.chinese: 看上去好象已經有了誤會。

sentences.english: It seems to me that he's been labouring under a bit of a misapprehension.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲他已經因爲一點誤會苦惱了很久。

sentences.english: You must have mistaken my intentions.
sentences.chinese: 你一定是誤會了我的意圖了。

sentences.english: The misunderstanding between us has been cleared up.
sentences.chinese: 我們之間的誤會渙然冰釋。

sentences.english: At Ao Long Guo of time, the Feng feather once had misconceiving to Long Qi.
sentences.chinese: 在傲龍國的時候，鳳羽曾經對龍琦有過誤會。

definition: inconvenient/troublesome/annoying/to trouble or bother sb/to put sb to trouble
to think (i.e. to take it to be true that ...) (Usually there is an implication that the notion is mistaken – except when expressing one's own current opinion.)
to play a joke/to make fun of/to joke
relation/relationship/to concern/to affect/to have to do with/guanxi/CL:個|个[ge4]
